trans-unit.source: Bridges are entities that help in message mediation.
trans-unit.target: Bridges are entities that help in message mediation.

trans-unit.source: Message mediation involves performing a series of processing steps such as decoding, validating, enriching, and transforming the message as it travels from its originating source to its destination.
trans-unit.target: Message mediation involves performing a series of processing steps such as decoding, validating, enriching, and transforming the message as it travels from its originating source to its destination.

trans-unit.source: If we consider the ESB pattern where systems are loosely coupled and are communicating via messages, bridges can be thought of as a combination of an on-ramp, a pipeline, and an off-ramp.
trans-unit.target: If we consider the ESB pattern where systems are loosely coupled and are communicating via messages, bridges can be thought of as a combination of an on-ramp, a pipeline, and an off-ramp.

trans-unit.source: Following are the characteristics of bridges provided with <token>af_integration</token>:
trans-unit.target: Following are the characteristics of bridges provided with <token>af_integration</token>:

trans-unit.source: Bridges are composed of stages and activities where each stage is a message processing unit in itself.
trans-unit.target: Bridges are composed of stages and activities where each stage is a message processing unit in itself.

trans-unit.source: Each stage of a <token>bridge</token> is atomic, which means either a message completes a stage or not.
trans-unit.target: Each stage of a <token>bridge</token> is atomic, which means either a message completes a stage or not.

trans-unit.source: A stage can be turned <legacyItalic>on</legacyItalic> or <legacyItalic>off</legacyItalic>, indicating whether to process a message or simply let it pass through.
trans-unit.target: A stage can be turned <legacyItalic>on</legacyItalic> or <legacyItalic>off</legacyItalic>, indicating whether to process a message or simply let it pass through.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram presents a pictorial representation of how different stages of a pipeline are tied together:
trans-unit.target: The following diagram presents a pictorial representation of how different stages of a pipeline are tied together:

trans-unit.source: There are two types of <token>bridge</token> templates –<legacyItalic>generic</legacyItalic> and <legacyItalic>specific</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: There are two types of <token>bridge</token> templates –<legacyItalic>generic</legacyItalic> and <legacyItalic>specific</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: A <embeddedLabel>generic</embeddedLabel> template is a customizable template and is the starting point of specific templates.
trans-unit.target: A <embeddedLabel>generic</embeddedLabel> template is a customizable template and is the starting point of specific templates.

trans-unit.source: You can use this template to create a customized bridge that suits your requirements.
trans-unit.target: You can use this template to create a customized bridge that suits your requirements.

trans-unit.source: A <embeddedLabel>specific</embeddedLabel> template is a specialized case of the generic template, which is designed for a specific use.
trans-unit.target: A <embeddedLabel>specific</embeddedLabel> template is a specialized case of the generic template, which is designed for a specific use.

trans-unit.source: One example of a specific template is the <embeddedLabel>XML bridge</embeddedLabel> template that specializes in processing XML messages.
trans-unit.target: One example of a specific template is the <embeddedLabel>XML bridge</embeddedLabel> template that specializes in processing XML messages.

trans-unit.source: This release of <token>af_integration</token> provides only the specific bridge templates – <token>one-way</token>, <token>request_response</token>, and <token>passthru</token>.
trans-unit.target: This release of <token>af_integration</token> provides only the specific bridge templates – <token>one-way</token>, <token>request_response</token>, and <token>passthru</token>.

trans-unit.source: This section provides more information about these bridges, including the stages, uses of the template, and so on.
trans-unit.target: This section provides more information about these bridges, including the stages, uses of the template, and so on.
